sentence.Network_en: Britain needs to bridge the technology gap between academia and industry.

phrase.cizu_name: cross that bridge when one comes to it

jx.jx_en_mean: to deal with a problem when and if it arises
jx.jx_cn_mean: 待到问题出现时再解决不迟

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  brycg (noun), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch brug and German Brücke

entry.def: A bridge is a structure that is built over a railway, river, or road so that people or vehicles can cross from one side to the other.

example.ex: He walked back over the railway bridge.
example.tran: 他从铁路桥上走了回去。

entry.def: A bridge between two places is a piece of land that joins or connects them.

example.tran: 连接塞尔维亚不同地区的陆桥

entry.def: To bridge the gap between two people or things means to reduce it or get rid of it.

example.ex: It is unlikely that the two sides will be able to bridge their differences.
example.tran: 双方不太可能消除彼此之间的分歧。

entry.def: Something that bridges the gap between two very different things has some of the qualities of each of these things.

example.ex: ...the singer who bridged the gap between pop music and opera.
example.tran: 将通俗音乐与歌剧结合起来的歌手

entry.def: If something or someone acts as a bridge between two people, groups, or things, they connect them.

example.ex: We hope this book will act as a bridge between doctor and patient...
example.tran: 我们希望这本书能成为医生与患者之间沟通的桥梁。

example.ex: They saw themselves as a bridge to peace.
example.tran: 他们把自己看作实现和平的使者。

entry.def: The bridge is the place on a ship from which it is steered.
The bridge of your nose is the thin top part of it, between your eyes.

example.ex: On the bridge of his hooked nose was a pair of gold rimless spectacles.
example.tran: 他的鹰钩鼻上架着一副金色无框眼镜。

entry.def: The bridge of a pair of glasses is the part that rests on your nose.

entry.tran: （小提琴、吉他等弦乐器的）琴马，琴桥
entry.def: The bridge of a violin, guitar, or other stringed instrument is the small piece of wood under the strings that holds them up.
A bridge is a piece of metal or plastic that holds false teeth in place by connecting them to natural teeth.
Bridge is a card game for four players in which the players begin by declaring how many tricks they expect to win.
If you burn your bridges, you do something which forces you to continue with a particular course of action, and makes it impossible for you to return to an earlier situation or relationship.

means.word_mean: 1. a structure that allows people or vehicles to cross an obstacle such as a river or canal or railway etc.
2. a circuit consisting of two branches (4 arms arranged in a diamond configuration) across which a meter is connected
3. something resembling a bridge in form or function;

sentences.sentence: "his letters provided a bridge across the centuries"

means.word_mean: 4. the hard ridge that forms the upper part of the nose;

sentences.sentence: "her glasses left marks on the bridge of her nose"

means.word_mean: 5. any of various card games based on whist for four players
6. a wooden support that holds the strings up
7. a denture anchored to teeth on either side of missing teeth
8. the link between two lenses; rests on nose
9. an upper deck where a ship is steered and the captain stands
1. connect or reduce the distance between

Sentence.sentence: On the way home at night, I relax with a good book or chat with friends or even have a game of bridge.

sentences.en: I am enthusiastic over a project for building a new bridge.
sentences.cn: 我热衷于修建一座新桥的计划。

sentences.en: London Bridge is an important construction in Britain.
sentences.cn: 伦敦桥是英国的一处重要建筑。

sentences.en: Gold rimmed spectacles bit deep into the bridge of his nose.
sentences.cn: 金边眼镜深深嵌入他的鼻梁。

sentences.en: Bridge is a very popular game of cards.
sentences.cn: 桥牌是一种很流行的纸牌游戏。

sentences.en: The engineers want to bridge the river.
sentences.cn: 工程师们想在这条河上架座桥。

jushi.english: There is a bridge across the river.
The old bridge can hardly bear up its own weight now.
jushi.chinese: 这座桥年代久了,现在几乎撑不起它本身的重量了。

jushi.english: The guerrillas blew up the bridge.
